title: How to Be a Wildlife Photographer

steps.headline: Invest in a good camera and lens.
steps.description: Plan on using at least as much money on a good telephoto lens as on the camera itself.

steps.headline: Sharpen your technique.
steps.description: For more details, see How to Shoot Wildlife Photography.

steps.headline: When you see an animal you want to photograph, sneak up on it like a hunter.
steps.description: If the animal sees you or hears you it will run away. Wildlife photography requires a whole lot of patience and stillness.

steps.headline: Consider choosing one area (or species) that hasn't been photographed a lot, so that you can have an edge.
Sell your photographs.
steps.description: You can sell your photos on your own website or to publishers, magazines and stock agencies. Your photos could end up where you least expect them-maybe in National Geographic magazine, which would be incredibly awesome!
